item.title: 高盛上调第四季度油价预期，因经合组织国家库存下降
item.description: 高盛将2026年第四季度布伦特原油和西德克萨斯中质原油价格预期分别上调6美元至60美元和56美元，理由是经合组织国家库存下降。不过该机构仍维持伊朗供应不会中断的假设，并坚持今年市场将出现过剩的观点。【原文：Goldman Sachs raised its Brent and West Texas Intermediate crude forecasts for the fourth quarter of 2026 by $6 to $60 and $56 respectively, citing lower OECD stocks, even as it continued to assume no Iran-related supply disruption and maintained its view of a surplus this year.】

item.title: 消息人士称，沙特阿美首次向美国企业及印度出售贾富拉凝析油货运
item.description: 据四位贸易消息人士透露，沙特国家能源巨头沙特阿美公司已向美国大型企业及印度炼油商出售了数批来自其价值1000亿美元贾富拉天然气厂的超轻质原油，该公司正准备在本月下旬出口首批货物。【原文：State energy major Saudi Aramco has sold several cargoes of ultra light crude oil from its $100 billion Jafurah gas plant to U.S. majors and an Indian refiner as it prepares to export its first cargo later this month, four trade sources said.】

item.title: 随着美国关税税率悬而未决，经济迷雾再度浓重
item.description: 美国及外国官员、企业高管、分析师和投资者曾开始期待，去年动荡的美国贸易政策反复已告终结。如今，他们却面临着因美国最高法院上周裁决而重燃的不确定性——该裁决推翻了特朗普总统关税计划的关键部分，而特朗普随后又暗示将实施大幅加征关税作为规避措施。【原文：U.S. and foreign officials, corporate executives, analysts and investors had begun to hope the tumultuous U.S. trade policy reversals of last year were finished. Now they face rekindled uncertainty from a U.S. Supreme Court ruling last week that struck down key parts of President Donald Trump's tariff plans and his ensuing suggestion of substantial levies coming in an attempted workaround.】

item.title: 美国关税风波令国债市场陷入迷茫
item.description: 最高法院推翻特朗普总统关税的裁决非但未能缓解市场担忧，反而为贸易政策、美国债务和美元注入了新的风险与不确定性。【原文：Far from being a source of relief, the Supreme Court's takedown of President Donald Trump's tariffs has infused new risks and uncertainties into trade policy, U.S. debt and the dollar.】

item.title: 韩国与巴西同意扩大关键矿产及贸易领域合作
item.description: 韩国总统李在明周一在首尔与巴西总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦举行峰会会谈，双方同意在贸易、关键矿产、科技和文化等领域扩大合作。【原文：South Korean President Lee Jae Myung held summit talks in Seoul on Monday with Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, where they agreed to expand cooperation in sectors including trade, key minerals, technology and culture.】

item.title: 关税混乱的代价
item.description: 韦恩·科尔为您解析欧洲及全球市场今日展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.】

item.title: 澳大利亚Lendlease集团上半年转亏，股价跌至近40年低点
item.description: 澳大利亚联盛集团周一公布上半年转亏，受投资物业重估及减值影响，其股价跌至近四十年低点。【原文：Australia's Lendlease Group swung to a first-half loss on Monday, hurt by investment property revaluations and impairments, sending its shares to a near four-decade low.】

item.title: 美国海关机构将停止征收最高法院周二裁定为非法的关税
item.description: 美国海关与边境保护局表示，将于周二东部时间凌晨12点01分（格林尼治时间0501）停止征收依据《国际紧急经济权力法》实施的关税。此前美国最高法院裁定该关税非法，距裁决已逾三日。【原文：The U.S. Customs and Border Protection agency said it will halt collections of tariffs imposed under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act at 12:01 a.m. EST (0501 GMT) on Tuesday, more than three days after the U.S. Supreme Court declared the duties illegal.】

item.title: 对美国最高法院裁决及特朗普新关税威胁的反应
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普表示，在最高法院推翻其大部分关税决定后，他将把对所有国家进口商品征收的临时关税从10%提高至15%。新关税依据的是另一项尚未实施的法律条款，即第122条。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said he will raise a temporary tariff on U.S. imports from all countries to 15% from 10%, following a Supreme Court decision striking down a large swath of his tariffs. The new levies are grounded in a separate but untested law, known as Section 122.】

item.title: 日本央行前政策制定者称若日元再度走弱或于三月加息
item.description: 日本央行前理事樱井诚向路透社表示，若日元在预计将于本月举行的美日首脑会晤前再度走弱，日本央行最早可能在3月加息。【原文：The Bank of Japan may raise interest rates as soon as March if the yen renews its slide ahead of a U.S.-Japan summit expected to be held during the month, former central bank board member Makoto Sakurai told Reuters.】

item.title: 美元走低，特朗普关税壁垒松动
item.description: 美元周一走低，因交易员将美国最高法院推翻特朗普总统大部分关税的裁决视为对全球经济增长的利好，但中东地区的混乱局势和冲突风险使汇率波动幅度相对有限。【原文：The dollar fell on Monday as traders took the U.S. Supreme Court's decision to strike down most of President Donald Trump's tariffs as supportive for global growth, though confusion and risk of conflict in the Middle East kept moves relatively small.】

item.title: 亚洲股市犹豫不决，美元因关税混乱而走低
item.description: 亚洲股市周一表现犹豫，美元汇率走低，投资者正等待美国关税政策出现亟需的明确信号。与此同时，科技巨头英伟达本周将公布的财报，将考验市场对整个人工智能板块的信心。【原文：Share markets were hesitant and the dollar slid in Asia on Monday as investors waited for some much-needed clarity on U.S. tariffs, while confidence in the entire AI trade was set to be tested by results from tech-diva Nvidia this week.】

item.title: 油价下跌，因美国提高关税引发对全球经济的担忧
item.description: 周一油价下跌，此前美国总统特朗普表示将提高美国对全球进口商品的关税，这给全球经济增长和燃料消费带来了不确定性。【原文：Oil prices slipped on Monday after President Donald Trump said he would raise U.S. tariffs on global imports, creating uncertainty for world economic growth and fuel consumption.】

item.title: 消息人士称，DAE Capital即将达成收购飞机租赁公司麦格理航空金融的交易
item.description: 据两位行业消息人士透露，总部位于迪拜的飞机租赁公司DAE Capital即将达成协议，收购租赁平台麦格理航空金融的控股权。【原文：Dubai-based aircraft lessor DAE Capital is closing in on a deal to buy control of leasing platform Macquarie AirFinance, two industry sources said.】

item.title: 据天空新闻报道，劳斯莱斯将通过股票回购向股东返还高达20亿美元。
item.description: 据天空新闻周日报道，劳斯莱斯控股公司预计将在本周公布年度业绩时宣布，将向投资者启动新一轮股票回购计划，回购规模高达15亿英镑（约合20.2亿美元）。【原文：Rolls-Royce Holdings is expected to announce alongside its annual results this week that it will launch a fresh share buyback worth as much as 1.5 billion pounds ($2.02 billion) to investors, Sky News reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 欧盟表示在最高法院裁决后不会接受美国加征关税："协议就是协议"
item.description: 欧盟委员会周日要求美国遵守去年达成的欧盟-美国贸易协定条款。此前美国最高法院推翻了特朗普政府实施的全球性关税政策，特朗普随即以全面加征新关税作为回应。【原文：The European Commission demanded on Sunday that the United States stick to the terms of an EU-U.S. trade deal reached last year, after the U.S. Supreme Court struck down Donald Trump's global tariffs and he responded with new levies across the board.】

item.title: 关税裁决无法消除贸易伙伴的不确定性
item.description: 最高法院推翻特朗普大部分关税的裁决削弱了他的影响力，但他仍可通过频频转向和政策变动让各国保持警惕。【原文：The Supreme Court's decision to strike down a large swath of Donald Trump's tariffs clips his wings, but he can still leverage rapid-fire pivots and changes to keep countries on their toes.】

item.title: 摩根大通称在1月6日袭击事件发生一个月后关闭了特朗普的银行账户
item.description: 摩根大通银行于2021年2月通知唐纳德·特朗普总统及其酒店业务，将关闭他们在该行的账户。这一消息源于周五披露的新文件，该文件是特朗普对该银行及其首席执行官杰米·戴蒙提起的50亿美元诉讼的一部分。【原文：JPMorgan Chase told President Donald Trump and his hospitality business in February 2021 it was closing their accounts at the bank, according to new documents released Friday as part of a $5 billion lawsuit Trump has filed against the bank and CEO Jamie Dimon.】

item.title: 阿联酋挫败网络攻击，国家通讯社称
item.description: 阿联酋国家通讯社周六报道称，该国已挫败针对其数字基础设施和关键部门的有组织网络攻击。【原文：The United Arab Emirates has thwarted organised cyber attacks targeting the country's digital infrastructure and vital sectors, the state news agency said on Saturday.】

item.title: 特朗普表示将把美国全球关税税率从10%提高至15%
item.description: 特朗普总统因最高法院裁定其动用紧急法案推进关税议程的举动无效而勃然大怒，随即对所有国家的进口商品征收临时关税。【原文：President Trump, infuriated by the Supreme Court's ruling against his use of an emergency law to push through his tariff agenda, imposed the temporary rate on imports from all countries.】

item.title: 德国的梅尔茨预计，在特朗普关税案美国法院作出裁决后，关税负担将减轻。
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希·梅尔茨周六表示，在特朗普总统大部分贸易关税被美国最高法院裁定无效后，他预计德国经济的关税负担将减轻。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said on Saturday he expected the tariff burden on the German economy to be lower after a U.S. Supreme Court ruling knocking down a large part of President Donald Trump's trade tariffs.】

item.title: 德国执政党支持对儿童实施社交媒体限制
item.description: 越来越多的国家，包括西班牙、希腊、法国和英国，正在考虑限制访问TikTok或Instagram等平台。【原文：A growing number of countries, including Spain, Greece, France and Britain, are looking at restrictions on accessing platforms like TikTok or Instagram.】

item.title: 关税政策主导之际，最高法院重申其制衡特朗普的权力
item.description: 在过去一年里，美国最高法院在二十余起案件中支持唐纳德·特朗普总统，助其扩大权力并迅速改变美国在移民、兵役、联邦雇佣等领域的政策。如今，最高法院终于触及了其权力的边界。【原文：After siding with President Donald Trump in two dozen cases in the past year in ways that boosted his power and let him quickly transform U.S. policies on immigration, military service, federal employment and beyond, the U.S. Supreme Court finally reached its limit.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员帕内塔表示，中国进口推动通胀降幅超预期
item.description: 欧洲央行一位高级政策制定者周六警告称，欧元区通胀风险在两个方向上都"相当大"，并补充说，廉价的中国进口商品对价格的影响值得密切关注。【原文：Risks to euro zone inflation are "significant" in either direction, a top European Central Bank policymaker warned on Saturday, adding that the impact on prices of cheap Chinese imports warranted close attention.】

item.title: 土耳其审查六家在线平台的儿童数据处理实践
item.description: 土耳其数据保护机构周五晚间表示，已对六家主要社交媒体平台启动审查，以评估其处理儿童个人数据的方式。【原文：Turkey's data protection authority said late on Friday that it has launched a review into six major social media platforms to assess how they handle children's personal data.】

item.title: 亚洲经济体权衡特朗普新关税举措的影响，市场陷入混乱
item.description: 美国在亚洲的贸易伙伴于周六开始权衡新的不确定性，此前数小时，美国总统特朗普誓言将对进口商品征收新关税，而最高法院刚刚推翻了他为发动全球贸易战而实施的许多广泛关税措施。【原文：U.S. trading partners in Asia started weighing fresh uncertainties on Saturday after President Donald Trump vowed to impose a new tariff on imports, hours after the Supreme Court struck down many of the sweeping levies he used to launch a global trade war.】

item.title: 对欧洲企业而言，美国关税减免背后暗藏玄机
item.description: 从欧洲葡萄酒生产商到化工企业和蒸馏酒制造商，美国最高法院推翻特朗普总统大部分贸易关税的裁决带来了一记回马枪：贸易前景变得更加扑朔迷离。【原文：From European wine makers to chemical companies and distillers, the U.S. Supreme Court ruling knocking down a large part of President Donald Trump's trade tariffs comes with a sting in the tail: an even more uncertain trade outlook.】

item.title: 美国贸易代表办公室预计，新一轮301条款调查将覆盖大多数主要贸易伙伴。
item.description: 美国贸易代表杰米森·格里尔周五表示，其办公室将根据1974年《贸易法》第301条款启动多项新调查，涵盖多数主要贸易伙伴及药品定价等领域。【原文：U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer on Friday said his office would initiate several new investigations under Section 301 of the Trade Act of 1974, covering most major trading partners and areas such as pharmaceutical product pricing.】

item.title: 玩具制造商评估在美国最高法院关税退税诉讼中的下一步行动
item.description: 通过向投资者出售潜在关税退税索赔权来规避风险的企业，在周五美国最高法院推翻特朗普总统广泛的紧急关税措施后欢欣鼓舞。【原文：Companies that hedged their bets by selling potential tariff refund claims to investors celebrated on Friday after the U.S. Supreme Court struck down President Donald Trump's sweeping emergency tariffs.】

item.title: 最高法院裁决后，律所为关税退税之争严阵以待
item.description: 美国最高法院周五裁定，总统特朗普无权依据一项旨在应对国家紧急状态的法律征收关税。此后，相关诉讼预计将转向美国国际贸易法院，多家企业已聘请大批律师团队，以期追回关税损失。【原文：After the U.S. Supreme Court ruled on Friday that President Donald Trump lacked authority to impose tariffs under a law meant for use in national emergencies, litigation is expected to turn to the U.S. Court of International Trade, where companies have already hired an army of lawyers to help them recoup their tariff losses.】
